Do not mix used and new batteries or batteries of different types. Always remove and recycle or dispose of old, weak, or worn-out batteries promptly.
Insert the (4) included batteries in the proper direction as indicated by positive (+) and negative (-) markings in the battery compartment, starting with the center

"Insert the Battery Extension Pack in the proper direction as indicated by positive (+) and negative (-) markings in battery compartment.
Using the opening tool supplied with your camera, a coin or a flat-head screw driver, tighten the built-in screw to the back of the camera. The accessory should be flush with the camera body."

Recycle or dispose of them in accordance with applicable laws and regulations.
Use the opening tool supplied with your camera, a coin or a flat-head screw driver to remove the battery cover by rotating the screw counter-clockwise.

"Align the guiding feature as shown, and hold the cover in place against the back of the camera.
Turn the screw clockwise until snug to secure the back cover. The cover should be flush with the camera body."

The image that is displayed when the Camera has low battery.
The connection to your camera seems to have been dropped. Please check that your Wi-Fi internet and power supply are working and that the camera is plugged in.

"Your camera is having difficulty communicating with the Sync Module.
Common causes are a weak signal to the Sync Module, or low batteries."

"Your camera is having difficulty communicating with the Blink Cloud.
Common causes are a weak signal to your Wi-Fi router or poor internet upload bandwidth."

Change network between Wi-Fi and Extended Range
"If the above steps don't resolve the issue, please contact Customer Support."
Vehicles or pedestrians in the distance.
Visitors approaching directly toward the camera. Side to side movement is more easily detected than forward-back.
The image that is displayed to indicate if the Camera has motion triggering enabled. Green for enabled. Grey for disabled.
"The button to go into the Camera's settings page."
Snooze motion enabled alerts off tap button
The camera did not respond to the Sync Module. Remove the batteries for 10 seconds, then reinsert them and try again.
Place the camera near a thermometer and leave idle for 15 minutes before calibrating. Then adjust the camera temperature to match.
Direct exposure to sunlight may affect temperature readings.
Your camera is unresponsive. Here are some troubleshooting steps to get that camera back online.
Reduce false motion events by repositioning the camera or reducing motion detection sensitivity.

Reduce your use of Live View.

"Connect the wires coming out of your wall to the screws on the back of your Blink Video Doorbell. If you have trouble connecting the wires coming out of your wall to the back of your Blink Video Doorbell, use the provided wire extensions and wire nuts.
It doesn't matter which wire connects to which screw. Tug gently on the wires to make sure wire connection is secure."

"Remove the paper template, then connect the wires to the screws on the back of Blink Video Doorbell. It doesn't matter which wire connects to which screw. Tug gently on the wires to make sure wire connection is secure."

"In order to troubleshoot issues with your account, Customer Support will need access to your account details. You can grant access below. Once granted, Customer Support will have access to your account details for 14 days. You can revoke access at any time by tapping the switch again.
Even when access is granted, Blink Customer Support Agents are never able to see your video clips or live views from a camera."

Introducing our all-new indoor/outdoor plug-in smart security camera.
The reset button is located on the bottom of the device. Depending on your application, you may need to remove the base to access the reset button.

"Your Blink Video Doorbell is operating in Event Response mode, which means certain features such as live view and two-way audio are available only in response to events (such as doorbell presses or motion alerts). To experience these features anytime on-demand in the app or through Alexa, connect to your home’s existing doorbell wiring or pair with a Blink Sync Module.
To make settings changes or update your thumbnail image while in Event Response mode, you must press the button on your doorbell to save the changes."
To upgrade your subscription, please use the Apple ID that was used for purchase.
The attached MicroSD Card is not compatible. Try inserting a different device or tap the link below to learn more about using external storage devices with the Sync Module.

Increase the amount of power going to your mechanical chime, then tap Continue. We recommend increasing 1–2 units at a time.
Sync Module 2 can back up your motion clips and Live Views to compatible USB storage. Insert a USB storage device into the Sync Module to get started.
You should see one black wire (for live), one white (for neutral), and one bare metal or green (for ground).

Shine a light on what matters most with Blink’s newest wire-free floodlight camera.
Higher IR LED intensity will reduce battery life.

"If the LED light doesn't blink RED after 30 seconds, try replacing your batteries.
While your LED light blinks RED, tap 'Continue'."

"If the lights don't display blinking blue and steady green after 30 seconds, try one of the following: \u0009• Press the reset button located above the camera housing \u0009• Or Power off, then back on the device by flipping the wall switch or circuit breaker."
"If the lights don't display blinking blue and steady green after 30 seconds, press and hold the reset button until the lights flash red and blue. This will take several seconds."
If the lights are not ready after 30 seconds, press and release the reset button.
"If the lights don't display blinking blue and steady green after 30 seconds, press and hold the reset button until you see a red light. This may take several seconds."
"Let's Link your Blink and Amazon accounts."
Link your Blink and Amazon accounts.
Linking accounts unites the strengths of Blink and Amazon and is required to activate subscription plans. More features are coming soon, so link your accounts today!

"When you link accounts, Blink and Amazon will use account information to provide integrated features and services, and as otherwise described in Blink's Privacy Notice and Amazon's Privacy Notice. Linking to an Amazon account is required to activate Blink Subscription Plans and manage your plans on Amazon."
Account linking will be available within the remaining 30 days of your free trial.

Blink Video Doorbell is only compatible with Doorbell Transformers rated at 16 – 24 volts AC at 50 or 60Hz, 40VA max."
You'll want to ensure that the voltage coming from the transformer matches the voltage of the chime (e.g. 16V chime should be wired to a 16V transformer)."
Assemble wedge(s) or corner(s) to create the desired camera angle. Then, position wedge(s)/corner(s) between 40\"-48\" high on your wall and drill holes through the slits in the wedge/corner.

Wiring extends your battery life and provides additional Blink camera features like Live View anytime. Without wiring, your doorbell will work in Event Response to preserve battery and provide basic smart doorbell functionality.
Would you like to wire your doorbell?

For a wired doorbell camera, please check that it is attached to the wall plate and that the breaker is on. Sometimes home wiring may be old or not working. This device does not work with broken wiring and you may need a professional electrician for advice regarding your home electrical environment. Please follow your local regulations.

Verify your Sync Module is displaying a solid green and solid blue light. If you see any other light pattern, power cycle your Sync Module, unplug the power cord from the back of the unit for 10 seconds and plug it back in. The Sync Module should then reboot and display a solid green and solid blue light within 45 seconds.
Verify your Wi-Fi connection is working: On your computer or mobile device connected to the same Wi-Fi network, visit a website to verify that your connection is working.

Adjust the light heads and camera.
Adjust the light heads and camera into the desired position. For covered ceiling mounting, rotate the camera to ensure that the Blink logo is readable when looking at the camera.
Remove the S-hook, then align the light fixture to the electrical box.

"Line up the center hole with the threaded post from the mounting bracket and slide the fixture onto the post. Use a Phillips-head screw driver to install the threaded nut marked \"H\" onto the post.
Insert the silicone plug \"I\" into the screw hole. Use appropriate outdoor silicone sealant (not included) to seal between the light fixture base and the wall."
Connect the wires from your electrical box to Wired Floodlight Camera.

"Use the provided S-hook to hang the Wired Floodlight Camera from the bracket while connecting the wires.
Connect the green wire from Wired Floodlight Camera to the green ground screw on the bracket and to the existing ground wire coming out of the electrical box. Connect the white wire to the white wire coming out of the electrical box with a wire nut. Do the same for the black wire. If your home wiring does not match this description, consult a licensed electrician."
"Unpack the screw bag, metal mounting bracket, and the S-hook. Unpack Wired Floodlight Camera. That's all you'll need for now."

"Using a handheld screwdriver, install the metal mounting bracket. Make sure the side marked \"Front\" faces you. Screw it down across two opposing holes on your electrical box. Ensure the metal mounting bracket is secure to the electrical box before moving to the next step.
Bag A - Standard screws that fit most metal electrical boxes
Bags B & C - Longer screws for recessed metal electrical boxes
Bags D, E, & F - Best for plastic electrical boxes with smaller screw holes"
"Remove your existing floodlight and mounting bracket. Uninstall according to the manufacturer's instructions. Be sure to remove any wires, wire nuts, screws, and hardware that came with the device."
Remove your existing floodlight and mounting bracket.
Wired Floodlight Camera requires an electrical box for installation.

"This device is designed to replace an existing floodlight, so it must be installed on a 4\" round UL listed weatherproof electrical box.
If you don't have one at your install location, get help from a licensed electrician."
Set how long lights will remain on after manual activation.
Set how long lights will remain on after motion activation.

A firmware update is required to perform this operation. Your Sync Module 2 will update automatically in the next 12 to 24 hours. Alternatively, you can format your storage device on your desktop or laptop and try again.
Your Sync Module 2 is offline. Please check it before trying again.
Your Sync Module is the hub of your Blink System so a good connection to your Wi-Fi is important.
Your Sync Module is the hub of your Blink System. It manages your cameras and sends them commands and settings changes, so a good connection to your Wi-Fi is important.
Sync Module failed to connect. The most common cause of failure when adding a device is an incorrect or mistyped Wi-Fi password. The Wi-Fi password you entered is displayed below.
"If you're having issues with your Sync Module's connection, try the steps below."
Sync Module can store your clips to compatible local storage device. Insert a MicroSD Card into the Sync Module to get started.
Sync Module can store your clips to compatible local storage device. Insert a USB Drive into the Sync Module to get started.

Your Sync Module is offline. If the issue does not resolve itself in a few minutes, you will need local access to the Sync Module to troubleshoot this issue. These troubleshooting steps may help to resolve this issue:
%1$s was not connected to the Blink cloud.

"Some common causes are internet or power outages, or moving the Sync Module and Wi-Fi router too far from each other.
If you would like more information we can send a help email with steps to change your Sync Module Wi-Fi settings and other troubleshooting steps:"
An email has been sent to the address registered to this account. Please allow a few minutes for the email to be received.
%1$s is not connected to the Blink cloud.

"Has your Wi-Fi password changed, or has your Wi-Fi router been replaced?

Now that your doorbell has been successfully added to your account. Tap \"Continue\" to complete set up.

"Insert Lithium AA batteries provided. The battery compartment door of the device ensures a watertight seal. Close it securely until it clicks. Keep the back plate off of your doorbell for now. You will need to screw it into the wall before reattaching the doorbell."
Blink cameras are only compatible with, size AA 1.5 volt Lithium non-rechargeable batteries.
